COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x126
STRING: [Chris] “So, tomorrow's the graduation recital, huh.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13c
STRING: I chose my topic, and started that conversation with
Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x150
STRING: [Lise] “...Yes, indeed.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16e
STRING: I hadn't told Lise about how I thought it'd be better for
us to get out of the city.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x184
STRING: But, there was no way we could hang around in the city
like this forever, surely.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19a
STRING: Even if we did get out, however, we didn't have
anywhere to go.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a6
STRING: I had my hometown, somewhere I could go back to.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b2
STRING: But as for Lise, she had nothing left.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c0
STRING: Neither the school nor that house of Grave's could
possibly be a place of comfort for Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d6
STRING: This room, with no one else but me, and the abandoned
Old Wing were the only places where she could smile.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ec
STRING: I wanted to be something like that for Lise, someone
she could rely on.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x202
STRING: Staying here and continuing to live the way we were
was nothing more than an illusion.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x218
STRING: The end of my time at school was coming, and soon I'd
have to leave this city.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x22e
STRING: Whether I graduated or not, I couldn't keep leeching off
my parents and stay here for free.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x244
STRING: If I asked, I'm sure my parents would support my living
here for another year or so.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x25a
STRING: But I couldn't possibly ask them to do that, just to keep
up this kind of lifestyle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x270
STRING: I could try working in this city, but then we'd never
escape the long shadow of Grave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x288
STRING: For that very reason, I hadn't been able to tell Lise
about wanting to leave the city.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29e
STRING: Living together was a lot harder than I'd thought, and I
wasn't able to make a decision yet.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b6
STRING: However, if Lise wanted it, that would definitely
motivate me to decide.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2de
STRING: [Chris] “Okay, time to get up.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x324
STRING: Even playing the Fortelle seemed like a bit too much for
me right now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x33a
STRING: I enjoyed playing for our ensembles day in and day out,
but I couldn't shake the feeling that I'd lost sight of our
goal.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x35a
STRING: As long as Lise kept singing with her usual smile,
however, I was okay with that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x370
STRING: But the thought of changing our present situation, even
a little, was becoming something of an obsession.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x386
STRING: [Chris] “Do you want to go back to school?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x39c
STRING: I trembled inside as I asked Lise that question.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3c4
STRING: [Lise] “...No.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3da
STRING: Lise gave the expected answer.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3e6
STRING: I also thought of asking her what she wanted to do.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3f2
STRING: But Lise was probably relying on me and me alone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3fe
STRING: That's why I needed to tell her about leaving the city
together, but I couldn't.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x414
STRING: [Chris] “What are we going to do?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x42a
STRING: For the first time, I put that anxiety into words.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x436
STRING: Lise had asked me that same question many times.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x442
STRING: But it had always been about trivial stuff, like what to
eat, or whether to have an ensemble.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x458
STRING: Perhaps, for Lise, those were the forms that her anxiety
had taken.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x476
STRING: [Lise] “...In that case...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x48c
STRING: Shall we sing?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x498
STRING: I was sure that Lise was going to say that next.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4ae
STRING: And I'd be relieved to hear those words, enough to
want to continue living like this for one more day.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4c4
STRING: But...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4ec
STRING: [Lise] “What do you want to do, Chris?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x502
STRING: [Chris] “Huh? As in, an ensemble or something?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x534
STRING: [Lise] “No, from now on. From tomorrow... The two of
us.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x554
STRING: [Chris] “...Lise.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x586
STRING: [Lise] “Chris... Haven't you been thinking about that all
this while?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5a6
STRING: [Chris] “...Yeah, I might have.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5bc
STRING: In fact, I was thinking about it just now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5c8
STRING: But I gave a vague answer, on purpose.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5d4
STRING: Because I wasn't sure if it was the right time to talk
about it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5f2
STRING: [Lise] “In that case, could you tell me what's on your
mind? I've been waiting, wondering when you would
tell me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x612
STRING: [Chris] “Waiting... for me?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x644
STRING: [Lise] “Yes. Singing is really fun, of course, and I still
think it'd be great if this week could last forever.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x68a
STRING: [Lise] “But, I also know that this can't be everything.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6b2
STRING: [Lise] “The times you were lost deep in thought, Chris. I
knew that you were probably thinking about that.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6ee
STRING: [Lise] “But I... I only had you and your room, Chris, and
so I waited.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x726
STRING: For you to tell me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x758
STRING: [Lise] “But you seemed especially troubled today, so I
bit the bullet and said it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x778
STRING: [Chris] “I... I see.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x78e
STRING: Perhaps Lise had been thinking about this for a while
now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x79a
STRING: She didn't stumble over her words at all, and in fact she
looked glad at being able to say them out loud.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7b0
STRING: [Chris] “So... Is it okay for me to say what I think?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7e2
STRING: [Lise] “Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7f8
STRING: [Chris] “I want to get out of this city. I... I don't have any
fixed plans yet, so this will sound really stupid, but...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x83e
STRING: [Lise] “No, it doesn't... You've given this a lot of thought,
haven't you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x854
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x886
STRING: [Lise] “But once we leave here, how will we make a
living?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8a6
STRING: [Chris] “Well, that's...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8d8
STRING: [Lise] “We just have to do what we like, and things will
work out, right?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8ee
STRING: Right then, Lise seemed like a normal girl talking about
her dreams.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8fa
STRING: She only saw a bright, imaginary happiness, without any
worries about the future.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x910
STRING: I wasn't going to deny her that, of course.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x91c
STRING: In fact, I wanted to believe in it too.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x928
STRING: The fact that Lise believed in me enough to say that
made me very happy.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x93e
STRING: [Chris] “...Yeah, they will.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x954
STRING: As long as Lise was with me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x960
STRING: And I'm sure Lise felt the same way about me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x992
STRING: [Lise] “But I have just one request.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9a8
STRING: [Chris] “What is it? If I can do it, I will.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9da
STRING: [Lise] “It's about the song... The one I've been singing...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9f0
STRING: [Chris] “Yes?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa22
STRING: [Lise] “I want you to look for the score with me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa38
STRING: [Chris] “The score... But where should we look? Didn't
you say that not even the school's archives had it?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa74
STRING: [Lise] “That score... It's somewhere in that house.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa8a
STRING: [Chris] “Your house...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xabc
STRING: [Lise] “Actually... I'm an orphan.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xad4
STRING: Lise didn't know that I'd already heard about the facts
from Grave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaea
STRING: The words that had come out of Grave's mouth were
beyond cruel.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb00
STRING: At that time, Lise had been scared, she'd already been
hurt.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb0c
STRING: I couldn't have repeated those words to her then.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb18
STRING: [Chris] “...I see.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb2e
STRING: And so I pretended I was hearing it for the first time,
and waited for Lise to continue.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb68
STRING: [Lise] “You don't seem too surprised.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb7e
STRING: [Chris] “There are well-known stories of nobility doing
such things, that's why.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbb2
STRING: That was true.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbbe
STRING: It wasn't because they couldn't have children of their
own, nothing that simple.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbd4
STRING: Everyone knew the stories about nobility who gave their
names to talented unknowns in order to raise their own
reputation.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbf4
STRING: And before me stood a girl whose existence proved
that those stories were true.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc12
STRING: [Lise] “When I was taken in by the shelter, apparently
the only thing I had on me was that score.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc3a
STRING: [Lise] “At that time, I wasn't able to read yet, but I'd
always sing along when the teacher at the shelter
played the score on the piano, or so I've heard.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc80
STRING: [Lise] “But my father wouldn't let me sing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcbc
STRING: [Lise] “After all, he'd taken me in for the purpose of
playing the Fortelle, and he had no need of a child who
developed other interests.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xce6
STRING: [Chris] “...No.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcfc
STRING: I wanted to tell her otherwise, but I couldn't.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd08
STRING: What she was thinking was exactly the truth.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd14
STRING: Lise didn't seem to notice my consternation, and she
went on.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd46
STRING: [Lise] “And then father took that score from me and hid
it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd66
STRING: [Chris] “In short, it's somewhere in that house.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd98
STRING: [Lise] “Actually, I have some idea where he hid it. I'm
certain it's somewhere in the study.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdc0
STRING: [Lise] “Once, I don't remember when, I happened to see
him looking at that score in the study.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdfc
STRING: [Lise] “At the time, I ran away at once because I thought
I'd done a terrible thing, but that was my score, I'm sure
of it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe2e
STRING: [Lise] “And then, I heard it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe4c
STRING: [Lise] “Father was playing the accompaniment to that
song on the Fortelle.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe6c
STRING: [Chris] “But why would he keep that score?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe9e
STRING: [Lise] “Perhaps he recognized the merit of that song.
Just like you did, Chris, when you first played it for me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xec8
STRING: [Chris] “...I see.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xede
STRING: I wondered if such a thing were possible.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeea
STRING: My first thought was that it wasn't consistent with
Grave's true nature, but he did have a real ear for music,
so perhaps it was true.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf12
STRING: [Lise] “That's why I'm certain it's in that study. Hiding in
the hallway shadows, I watched him until he left the
room. His hands were empty.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf3c
STRING: [Chris] “...But, how are we going to get into that study.
You have guards, don't you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf78
STRING: [Lise] “Father... He doesn't trust other people, so aside
from the help, there's no one in that house.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfaa
STRING: [Lise] “And those people leave as soon as their work is
done.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfca
STRING: [Chris] “Which means, as long as he's not around,
getting inside will be easy?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1006
STRING: [Lise] “I think so, yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x101c
STRING: [Chris] “Then let's go when he's out...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x103a
STRING: [Lise] “That would be today.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1050
STRING: [Chris] “...Today?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x106e
STRING: [Lise] “Every year, starting in December, he has special
classes at the school on Thursdays. That's the only day
he comes home late.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1098
STRING: [Chris] “Now that you mention it...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10ae
STRING: Ms. Cordell had said something about him being in a
lecture room even when there were no students.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10c4
STRING: But no, what he was really doing with all that spare
time was making Lise practice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10f6
STRING: [Lise] “That's why I knew that today would be my last
chance to tell you about this. That score, it's very
important to me.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1128
STRING: [Lise] “That song helped me realize that singing was
what I really liked.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1148
STRING: [Chris] “...I understand. We'll leave at noon.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1166
STRING: [Lise] “...Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x117c
STRING: Perhaps this was for the best, in the end.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1188
STRING: There were many, many other things I had to think
about.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1194
STRING: But this feeling was the real deal.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11d4
STRING: It was a few minutes past noon.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x11fc
STRING: [Lise] “Well, let's go.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1212
STRING: [Chris] “Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1228
STRING: Lise was already prepared and standing in the doorway.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1234
STRING: Following right behind her, I turned around just as I
stepped out the door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x124a
STRING: [Chris] “See you later.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1268
STRING: [Lise] “See you later.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12b6
STRING: [Phorni] “Take care, you guys.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12cc
STRING: [Chris] “Phor-”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x12ea
STRING: [Phorni] “Be quiet.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1308
STRING: ...Phorni had somehow moved to where the towels
were always laid out, and was hovering by the front
door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1344
STRING: [Lise] “...What's the matter?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1376
STRING: [Phorni] “It won't take long. You don't have to say
anything.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x138c
STRING: [Chris] “...It's nothing. But, could you wait just one
moment?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13be
STRING: [Lise] “I don't mind.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x13fe
STRING: [Phorni] “I heard everything.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1414
STRING: I nodded very slightly, motioning for Phorni to continue.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x143c
STRING: [Phorni] “There's nothing more for me to say, except...
Good luck.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1452
STRING: Why was Phorni saying this now, at this timing?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1468
STRING: If Lise hadn't been there, I would've been able to ask,
but...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x149a
STRING: [Phorni] “I'll be gone for some time again, so this is
goodbye.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14b0
STRING: “Wait a second!“ I almost shouted that out loud.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14e2
STRING: [Phorni] “Lise is a good girl. I feel safe leaving you in her
hands.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x151e
STRING: [Phorni] “I don't want her to wait too long, so just one
last thing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1550
STRING: [Phorni] “Be good to each other, okay.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x157e
STRING: Bye bye.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x159e
STRING: [Chris] “Wait!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15b4
STRING: I finally did say it out loud, but I had the feeling
somehow that Phorni would never be back.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15e0
STRING: [Lise] “...I'm waiting?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x15f6
STRING: Behind me, standing just outside the doorway, Lise
sounded puzzled.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x160c
STRING: [Chris] “Uh... Yeah. Sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1640
STRING: [Lise] “Is something wrong? You look a little pale.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1660
STRING: [Chris] “...It's nothing, I'm fine. I was just making sure
that I hadn't forgotten anything.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1680
STRING: I put a smile back on my face and turned to Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x168c
STRING: Phorni must have had her own reasons for saying all
that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16a2
STRING: Perhaps she really wouldn't ever appear again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16ae
STRING: I had wanted to have a proper talk with Phorni, when I
moved out or whenever.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16c4
STRING: But I couldn't afford to agonize over that right now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16d0
STRING: [Chris] “Alright, let's go.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1702
STRING: [Lise] “Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x171a
STRING: But I fully intended to uphold Phorni's last words to me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1726
STRING: [Chris] “See you later.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x173c
STRING: I said that one last time, and then I was out the door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1790
STRING: The rain today was light, gentle almost.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x179c
STRING: We didn't need to use the umbrella, it even felt a bit
warm out.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17b2
STRING: Running my hands through my only slightly damp hair, I
looked up at that house once again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17c8
STRING: It was enormous, and it felt hollow.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17d4
STRING: It felt especially so, after hearing Lise's story.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x17fc
STRING: [Lise] “I have the key, let's go in.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1812
STRING: [Chris] “Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1846
STRING: It was kind of dark inside, and it didn't feel like anyone
lived there at all.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x185c
STRING: The interior was extravagantly furnished, as expected,
but it didn't impress me much.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1872
STRING: And after finding out about Grave's personality, I didn't
find it in good taste.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1890
STRING: [Lise] “Here it is.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18a6
STRING: Lise stood in front of a room on the second floor,
somewhere in the back of the house, and slowly
opened the door.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18f4
STRING: Lise had called it a study, and it certainly was full of
books and documents related to music.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x190a
STRING: The room where I lived was tiny compared to this one.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1916
STRING: It wasn't as large or well-stocked as the school's
archives, of course, but in terms of quality, the two were
probably similar.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1952
STRING: [Lise] “It has to be somewhere in this room.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1968
STRING: [Chris] “Even so, it's pretty big.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x199a
STRING: [Lise] “...I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19b0
STRING: Even though I was only stating an honest opinion, Lise
reacted sensitively and apologized.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19c6
STRING: That wasn't my intention at all, so I hastily corrected
myself.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x19d2
STRING: [Chris] “Still, there aren't that many places in here where
one could hide a score, so it's okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a0e
STRING: [Lise] “I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a24
STRING: [Chris] “Look, I said...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a3a
STRING: Then I stopped and realized that it was coming back to
this house that was causing Lise to withdraw.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a50
STRING: Perhaps it was because the house itself didn't hold that
many good memories for her.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a66
STRING: And this room was a symbol of Grave, in some way.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a7c
STRING: [Chris] “Anyway, don't mind me. I'll start over here, you'll
start there, Lise.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1a9e
STRING: As long as we were doing something, we could forget
about what I'd said.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ab4
STRING: I started with a bookcase with glass doors that was on
our left as we entered.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1aca
STRING: Lise investigated a similar bookcase that was on the
opposite side of the room.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ae0
STRING: I didn't know exactly when Grave would return, but it'd
probably be at least a half hour after the scheduled end
of the lecture.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b00
STRING: That gave us about three hours from now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b0c
STRING: [Chris] “Now then...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b22
STRING: We had to go over the entire place in the end, but we
were looking out for envelopes, cases, anything that
might hold a score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b38
STRING: Given that the score was handwritten, we ignored all
the books.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b4e
STRING: [Chris] “First...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1b8c
STRING: In case we needed to make a hasty exit, we didn't put
anything on the floor during our search.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ba2
STRING: Whatever we took for inspection was placed back in its
original position.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bae
STRING: After searching for over an hour, I became somewhat
tired.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bc4
STRING: I stopped for a while and spoke to Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1bd0
STRING: [Chris] “We still have some time, let's take a short break.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c0a
STRING: [Lise] “Huh? A-Alright...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c2c
STRING: Lise had been so focused on the task, she only
responded after a while.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c44
STRING: I had gone through about half of my designated area.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c50
STRING: At this pace, we were bound to find it within the time
we had left.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c5c
STRING: But if we didn't, what were we going to do?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c72
STRING: Sneaking back in here would be dangerous, honestly
speaking.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c7e
STRING: Things would be different if Lise were still living here,
but in our present situation, it was hard for us to know
when he would definitely be out.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1c96
STRING: If only he were the kind of musician who still gave
regular concerts, but Grave no longer did that, his main
activities were composing, lecturing, and instructing the
next generation.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cb6
STRING: Speaking of which, during my search, I was astounded
by the number of his compositions.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cce
STRING: I'd expected a much smaller number of handwritten
scores.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ce4
STRING: But there were a lot of them.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1cfa
STRING: I saw the names of many other composers, but there
were definitely many of his own compositions there.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d12
STRING: The one saving grace was the fact that all his
handwritten scores had been consolidated and
arranged neatly, perhaps due to a meticulous nature.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d28
STRING: Although his goal was to hide that score from Lise, I
didn't think that he'd hide it somewhere else, all by
itself.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d3e
STRING: He had so many scores, it wasn't strange to think that
that one score would be safe here.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d82
STRING: [Lise] “...Chris?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1d98
STRING: [Chris] “Hmm? What's up?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1dca
STRING: [Lise] “Are you tired?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1de0
STRING: [Chris] “Nah, I'm okay. What about you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1e12
STRING: [Lise] “I'm fine.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1e28
STRING: [Chris] “I see. We're about halfway done, so we can rest
a bit longer.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1e64
STRING: [Lise] “Okay, but you're not tired, are you?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1e7a
STRING: [Chris] “No, why do you ask?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1eac
STRING: [Lise] “In that case, shall we do an ensemble? Just once
will be fine.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ecc
STRING: [Chris] “Ha-ha, why not, it'll be a nice diversion.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1eea
STRING: [Lise] “There's even a Fortelle here, conveniently
enough.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f00
STRING: [Chris] “Got it. I'll set things up.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f16
STRING: We still had plenty of time left.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f22
STRING: We could do one ensemble, probably.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f2e
STRING: The Fortelle sat in one corner of the room and was
covered in a thin layer of dust, perhaps it hadn't been
played in a long time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f44
STRING: [Chris] “Okay, here we go.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f62
STRING: [Lise] “Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f94
STRING: Lise started singing, and her visible enjoyment made me
enjoy playing the Fortelle as well.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1faa
STRING: Lise had only added the lyrics after some time, perhaps
that's why they sounded a little more stoic.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1fc0
STRING: They probably spoke of how she felt when she was
alone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1fcc
STRING: But those lyrics sang of hope in the end.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1fd8
STRING: Perhaps that had been her wish all along.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1fe4
STRING: Perhaps she'd wanted to be in that state of mind now,
and thought of the song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2026
STRING: After we finished the ensemble, we resumed the search.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x203c
STRING: That's when the thought came to me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2048
STRING: [Chris] “Hey Lise, didn't you say that he had played that
song in this room?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x208c
STRING: [Lise] “Yes. On that very Fortelle.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20a2
STRING: The Fortelle was permanently set up in a corner of the
room, so its case was almost irrelevant.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20b8
STRING: Or it should've been. But there wasn't much dust on it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20c4
STRING: It definitely should have been left alone before the
Fortelle was, but the amount of dust covering both
objects looked quite similar.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20da
STRING: [Chris] “Let's take a look inside, shall we...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20f0
STRING: I opened the case.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20fc
STRING: [Chris] “This is...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2112
STRING: The score, written on old parchment, lay inside the
case, uncovered.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2128
STRING: With one look, I knew it was her song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2134
STRING: [Chris] “Lise! It's here!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2166
STRING: [Lise] “Huh? R-Really?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x217c
STRING: Lise ran over and held up the parchment.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x21a4
STRING: [Lise] “Th-This is it. Without a doubt.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x21ba
STRING: As if she was trying to confirm it tactilely, Lise kept
running her fingers over its surface, then she hugged it
fondly.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x21da
STRING: [Chris] “...Great. Now let's get out of here, prestissimo.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x220c
STRING: [Lise] “...Yes. Thank you, really.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2222
STRING: [Chris] “Don't mention it.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2238
STRING: But Lise didn't hear a word I'd said, and her eyes went
back to the score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x224e
STRING: Somewhat intrigued, I peeked at it from behind.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x225a
STRING: [Chris] “Was this song some kind of gift, perhaps?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2270
STRING: The title said nothing more than “Esque,” which could've
been someone's name.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2286
STRING: [Chris] “As for the actual lyrics...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x229c
STRING: I tried reading the words written on the score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x22c4
STRING: [Lise] “This is... A love song, surely.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x22da
STRING: Lise must've read it the way I did, since she seemed to
have the same opinion.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x22f0
STRING: [Chris] “I guess the composer wrote this love song for
the person in the title?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x232c
STRING: [Lise] “I had no idea. But, just maybe...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x234c
STRING: [Chris] “Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2362
STRING: The fact that Lise had this score implied one possibility.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2378
STRING: One of Lise's real parents must have either written the
song or received it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x238e
STRING: Or perhaps one had written it for the other.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x239a
STRING: [Chris] “The composer's name is...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23b0
STRING: I looked for the name written at the end of the score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23bc
STRING: I turned to the very last page and read the name there.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23c8
STRING: [Chris] “Grave... Huh? What the...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23fa
STRING: [Lise] “What? Did Father have something to do with
this?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2410
STRING: Lise also tried to confirm the composer's name.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2438
STRING: [Lise] “Grave Cesarini...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2466
STRING: No way...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2476
STRING: Upon closer inspection, the writing matched what I'd
seen in the other scores.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x248c
STRING: Lise had recognized the score with such certainty, so it
probably hadn't been tampered with.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x24a2
STRING: Then, why...?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x24da
STRING: [Grave] “I thought I heard a Fortelle... It appears I have
uninvited guests.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x252a
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x255c
STRING: [Lise] “F-Father...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x257a
STRING: [Grave] “What are you doing?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2590
STRING: [Chris] “...I'm looking for something.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x25ae
STRING: [Grave] “Defiant, aren't we? Now that's what they call
rogue courage.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x25ea
STRING: [Lise] “F-Forgive me...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2600
STRING: [Chris] “There's no need to apologize. You simply came
for what's yours, after all.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2620
STRING: Grave's sudden appearance shocked me at first, then I
became confused.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2636
STRING: But seeing Lise's fear, I instantly regained my
composure.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2642
STRING: When I recalled how this man had caused her so much
pain, there was no space in my mind for anything but
rage.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2658
STRING: There was definitely the question of why Grave was the
composer of that song.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x266e
STRING: Even so, as I stood in front of Lise to protect her, I felt
an equal amount of courage rise within me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x268c
STRING: [Grave] “I was wondering what you were going to say. I
wrote that song, and I also gave to someone, once
upon a time.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x26ac
STRING: I knew what those words meant.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x26b8
STRING: The name of the composer was his, that was certain.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x26ce
STRING: But...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x26e2
STRING: [Grave] “...Liselsia.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2714
STRING: [Lise] “Y-Yes...?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2732
STRING: [Grave] “I always knew you'd come back. That was
precisely why I'd left you alone this past week, without
saying a word.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2778
STRING: [Lise] “B-But...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2796
STRING: [Grave] “It had occurred to me that today would be that
day... How fortunate that I came home early.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27b6
STRING: In a complete about-turn, Grave spoke to Lise with what
almost sounded like kindness.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27cc
STRING: Was he worried?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27d8
STRING: This man couldn't possibly have such feelings toward
Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27e4
STRING: Everything he said was a lie.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x27f0
STRING: [Chris] “...Lise.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x280e
STRING: [Grave] “After you left, I had a revelation. I've been too
hard on you this whole time, for which I'm truly
remorseful, Liselsia.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2854
STRING: [Lise] “F-Father...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2880
STRING: [Grave] “...I had wished to wait until you became an
adult before telling you this, but let us speak of it now.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x28a0
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x28be
STRING: What on earth did this hypocrite have to say now?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x28fa
STRING: [Chris] “Let's go, Lise...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x292c
STRING: [Lise] “W-Wait, Chris. I have to know...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2968
STRING: [Grave] “Chris Vertin. You must hear this as well. If you
want to be with Liselsia, that is your duty.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2992
STRING: I didn't trust those words one bit, thanks to what this
man had said before.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29a8
STRING: But Lise gripped the hem of my shirt, looking at me with
pleading eyes.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29be
STRING: I stopped and decided to hear him out, although I made
sure we were ready to go at any time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29d4
STRING: [Chris] “...Understood.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29f2
STRING: [Grave] “Then let us continue. That song was something
I wrote for a woman named Esque. And Esque was...
your mother's name, Liselsia.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a38
STRING: [Lise] “But... But that means...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a56
STRING: [Grave] “Yes. I am your real father.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a80
STRING: There were no words to express the shock I felt.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2a96
STRING: If that were true, it meant that he had done those
terrible things to his own daughter, his flesh and blood.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2ab4
STRING: [Grave] “The first time I saw you at the shelter, I didn't
know it. But once you started humming that song, I was
certain that you were my daughter.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b02
STRING: [Lise] “...Then what about my mother?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b20
STRING: [Grave] “At that time, I was a successful musician. But
because I was busy with work, I wasn't able to take
proper care of my family.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b52
STRING: [Grave] “And then, one day, Esque silently walked out,
taking you with her.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b72
STRING: As if he were the main character in some tragedy, Grave
gave an exaggerated sigh.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2b88
STRING: All his gestures looked staged, they made me sick.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2bba
STRING: [Lise] “Father...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2bd8
STRING: [Grave] “I did everything in my power to look for the
two of you, but I never succeeded...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2c00
STRING: [Grave] “Then, when I was giving a volunteer
performance at the shelter, I found you, Liselsia. And the
first thing I did was to take you in as my
daughter.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2c46
STRING: [Lise] “Wh-What about my mother?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2c64
STRING: [Grave] “Ahh, Esque's whereabouts. That was the one
thing I never found out. She probably found herself
unable to raise you alone, and was forced to leave
you at the shelter.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2c96
STRING: [Lise] “Father...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2cb4
STRING: [Grave] “Come back to me, Liselsia.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2cf4
STRING: Lise looked at my eyes.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d1e
STRING: She started to say something, then stopped herself, and
this went on for a while.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d34
STRING: Usually, this would be an emotional scene, ending with
me sending her off with tears of joy.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d4a
STRING: But there was no way I could've done that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d56
STRING: I still didn't believe a single word of what he'd said.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d62
STRING: [Chris] “...If you really are her father, then why did you
do such cruel things to Lise?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2d9e
STRING: [Grave] “To discipline her. A first-rate Fortelle player
doesn't have the time to sing songs.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2dd2
STRING: When he said the word “discipline,” his eyes gleamed
with a baleful light, just for a moment Or perhaps I'd
imagined it...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2e04
STRING: [Lise] “Chris...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2e1a
STRING: [Chris] “But in that case, why are saying all this now?
You were planning to wait until she became an adult...
Why?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2e60
STRING: [Grave] “I am a Cesarini. A noble is born a noble, for
better or for worse. I cannot run from my name.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2e92
STRING: [Grave] “The burden of carrying the name... One can
never run away from that.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2eba
STRING: [Grave] “I need, nay, this house needs to produce a
talented Fortelle player for the world to hear. To that
end, I cannot let emotions get in the way.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2eec
STRING: [Grave] “If I had told Liselsia that I was her real father,
she would have grown complacent. And by that token, I
would have been unable to maintain the proper
distance.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f1e
STRING: [Grave] “For that very reason, until Liselsia perfected her
technique, until she grew up, I had planned to stay
silent on this matter.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f5a
STRING: [Lise] “Father...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f70
STRING: [Chris] “＊gulp＊”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f86
STRING: I had to admit, his story did make some sense, at least.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2f92
STRING: But why did he say all those things to me before?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2fa8
STRING: How feet were unnecessary, or that there was no need
to hesitate...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2fb4
STRING: I just couldn't bring myself to believe him.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2fc0
STRING: [Chris] “Do you remember what you said to me last
week?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2fe8
STRING: [Grave] “Yes. I did say some harsh things, as I recall. But
it was all for Liselsia's sake.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3012
STRING: [Chris] “But...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3028
STRING: Those words were just too cruel, I couldn't repeat them
in front of Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x303e
STRING: Furthermore, Grave had given an explanation of his own
cruelty.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3070
STRING: [Lise] “Chris... I...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3086
STRING: Lise believed every word he said.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3092
STRING: It wouldn't have surprised me if she said that she was
going back to him.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x309e
STRING: But... If Grave was telling the truth, then Lise was
definitely much better off returning home.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x30d2
STRING: [Lise] “I'm sorry.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x30e8
STRING: Then...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x30f4
STRING: That's what Lise said.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3100
STRING: But she didn't say it to me, she'd said it to Grave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3126
STRING: [Lise] “I've decided to go with Chris.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x313c
STRING: I wondered how hard it had been for her to make that
decision.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3148
STRING: But Lise showed no sign of that struggle, her voice was
steady.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3166
STRING: [Grave] “...I see.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x317c
STRING: With equal solemnity, Grave nodded and remained
silent for a while.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3192
STRING: [Chris] “...Lise.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x31c4
STRING: [Lise] “It's fine. I... I may have misunderstood you, father.
But not anymore.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x31ec
STRING: [Lise] “And... I've also made a promise to Chris. I
promised I'd go with him. And so...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3214
STRING: [Grave] “I see... I know I've done cruel things to you,
Liselsia. If you do not wish to return, I will not force you
to.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3270
STRING: [Grave] “However...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3286
STRING: I thought he was going to try some other maneuver, but
Grave was just grandstanding again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x32a4
STRING: [Grave] “In the end, I am a Cesarini. I cannot be
expected to accept your decision right away.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x32e2
STRING: [Grave] “However, if you perform well at tomorrow's
graduation recital, I may be more amenable to granting
your request.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x331e
STRING: [Lise] “R-Really?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x333c
STRING: [Grave] “Chris Vertin.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3360
STRING: Grave turned to me and continued.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3374
STRING: [Grave] “Those are my conditions. Are we clear?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x338a
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x33bc
STRING: [Lise] “...Chris?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x33d2
STRING: [Chris] “...Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x33e8
STRING: Even if I didn't believe his story, this proposal wasn't a
bad idea.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x33fe
STRING: In other words, Grave would accept us as long as I,
instead of Lise, became a noteworthy musician.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3426
STRING: [Grave] “In that case, you should spend all your energy
on practicing today. I trust you haven't been completely
idle this past week?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3462
STRING: [Lise] “...I've been singing the whole time.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3494
STRING: [Grave] “Singing...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x34ae
STRING: Grave almost choked on that word.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x34ba
STRING: For that one moment, the calm in his voice disappeared,
and I felt a twinge of terror.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x34d0
STRING: But Lise was so moved by his words, she didn't notice a
thing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x34e6
STRING: [Chris] “...In that case, we'll take our leave. Lise?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3518
STRING: [Lise] “Ah...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3546
STRING: Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x356e
STRING: [Grave] “As you wish. I will be part of tomorrow's
judging panel. Let me say this now, I will not be lenient
in my scoring.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3598
STRING: [Chris] “...If that's all, please excuse us.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x35ca
STRING: [Lise] “Father... I'll... See you tomorrow.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x35e8
STRING: [Grave] “...Yes. As for this score, I'll keep it for now.
When the time comes, I'll hand it to you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3624
STRING: [Lise] “...Okay. I'll come back for it, definitely.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x363a
STRING: Lise was brimming with confidence.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x36a4
STRING: When we got back to my room, Lise immediately
started getting ready to sing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x36b8
STRING: [Lise] “Chris, the Fortelle, quickly.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x36ce
STRING: [Chris] “...I know.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x36e4
STRING: I had never seen Lise in such a good mood before.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x36f0
STRING: I couldn't tell her what I was thinking about, not right
now.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3706
STRING: It was a first for her, no doubt.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3712
STRING: For the first time in her life, Lise knew about her past,
and her singing was about to be accepted.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3728
STRING: No matter what Grave's intentions were, all I could do
now was to give the best performance of my life
tomorrow.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3748
STRING: [Chris] “Shall we take it from the top?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x377a
STRING: [Lise] “...Okay.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3790
STRING: I sat in front of the Fortelle and looked at Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x37a6
STRING: We matched our breathing, then Lise nodded.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3830
STRING: [Lise] “Phew...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3846
STRING: After one performance of the song, we both heaved a
great big sigh.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3852
STRING: There was no need to verbalize our opinions about how
it had sounded.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x385e
STRING: We both knew very well how we'd done.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x38b0
STRING: [Lise] “One more time?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3906
STRING: [Chris] “Sure. No matter how many times you practice,
it's never enough. Alright, here we go.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3942
STRING: [Lise] “Okay!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3988
STRING: [Chris] “Nah, let's call it a day.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x399e
STRING: [Chris] “I'm not sure when I'm performing, so we have to
be there first thing in the morning. Besides, we should
rest early, we don't want to be tired on stage.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x39e4
STRING: [Lise] “...That's true.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x39fa
STRING: I hadn't realized how late it was.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a06
STRING: It was only natural to be more focused when you had
an actual goal, as opposed to simply making music for
fun.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a1c
STRING: Tomorrow was... An incredibly important performance
for us.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a28
STRING: The later my turn was, the more time we'd have to
practice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a3e
STRING: Normally, I wouldn't mind doing the bare minimum, but
this time...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a54
STRING: In the last month or so, I'd changed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a60
STRING: And Lise had changed as well.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a6c
STRING: Tomorrow...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a78
STRING: After we put on an amazing performance...

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a84
STRING: Lise would change even more, I'm sure.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3a90
STRING: Grave couldn't be fully trusted, but the fact that he gave
us this chance at all was something to be grateful for.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3acc
STRING: [Lise] “...Tomorrow, then.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3ae2
STRING: [Chris] “...Yeah. It's kind of sudden, but you've been
singing the whole time, we'll be fine.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3b1e
STRING: [Lise] “Indeed!”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3b34
STRING: Lise looked at me with eyes full of hope.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3b40
STRING: I nodded in response, with renewed determination.
